summary: CurseForge shares quotes from Mod Developers
mainText:
'üí¨ "I never modded anything other than Minecraft, so I was quite scared of the learning curve. But to my surprise, everything that I wanted to do, I figured out very quickly... For mod makers who mostly add new assets, you are going to have a fun time." 
- @sketch_macaw'

summary: CurseForge shares quotes from Mod Developers
mainText:
'üí¨"The game's systems are very modular, which makes adding and modifying content feel intuitive. Creating new blocks and items only takes a few seconds, and it's great to get immediate in-game feedback as you iterate." 
- @DarkhaxDev'

summary: CurseForge shares quotes from Mod Developers
mainText:
'We gave a few mod authors early access to the tools, and here's what they have to say about their experience so far:
üí¨"Modding Hytale really took me out of my comfort zone; it is a completely new and different game compared to games I've modded in the past. The component system is insanely powerful, and all assets being hot reloadable made prototyping mods super fast." ‚Äî Jaredlll08'

summary: CurseForge shares official launch of Hytale modding page
mainText:
'Hytale mods are COMING SOONüëÄ

With Hytale‚Äôs launch right around the corner, we‚Äôre so excited to announce our partnership to support Hytale mods from Day 1!

Visit here to learn more about all of the tools that will be available for modders to bring their ideas alive:
http://hytale.curseforge.com'

summary: Slikey, re: World Gen V2 blog
mainText: 'Working with our level designers for over 10 years and they just keep innovating. The technical and workflow implications here are much bigger than they may appear on the surface! This is truly empowering for non-technical creative folks. Bright future ahead ü§©'

summary: Oscar, re: user asking if he's ready to be the next C418
mainText: 'haha I'm ready to be Oscar :D'

summary: Simon, re: WorldGen V2
mainText:
'As I mentioned publicly a few days ago, this new approach to world generation will redefine the block-game genre. For the first time, artists and game designers can take full ownership of world generation, with complete control over the final result. This is a fundamental shift away from a world shaped almost solely by programmers.

With that in mind, I'm pleased to announce that we're planning to expand the Hytale team with a new job role that, for the most part, has not existed in block-based games before: World Designer. Following the early access release, we plan to expand our team by hiring more than 15 World Designers. These roles will be filled primarily from the community, as artists and game designers learn and build using the same tools we use internally and choose to apply.

Hytale's vision is to feel carefully handcrafted while remaining infinitely procedural, with design always serving gameplay first!

We are intentionally expansive, just as we envisioned years ago. Beyond Orbis, we plan to explore alternate worlds, new dimensions, and entirely different spaces. These worlds give us room to introduce new blocks, items, prefabs, zones, regions, biomes, NPCs, quests, stories, and gameplay systems.'

summary: Hytale shares the World Gen V2 Blog
mainText:
'In today‚Äôs exciting new blog post, Dan and Amber dive deep into the future of Hytale‚Äôs world generation!
Discover the incredible new features, capabilities, and potential for both our players and creators. Screenshots, videos and more!
https://hytale.com/news/2026/1/the-future-of-world-generation
'

summary: Slikey, re: ARM64 support on Linux
mainText: 'For now, we will revisit this later but for launch we need to keep us stable. We don't even have a real CICD team, we are just making this work now and focus on complete coverage later.'

summary: Slikey, re: user suggesting Slikey talk to Hynergy
mainText: 'Got that on my radar, I will help them most by communicating our known limitations and saving them time trying to search for something that doesn't exist yet. There are some concepts I have seen we will need to provide some more capabilities to make it perfect.'

summary: Slikey, re: user saying MC modders are going to be faster/better for bugs
mainText:
'I have no doubt there will be some crazy 14 year olds with incredible skill making us all look like amateurs. 
Given the state of things and how broken some things are, it'll take us a while to get "clean" ways to do the most anticipated things but I am sure modders find creative ways to overcome any temporary limitations.'

summary: Slikey, re: user planning to learn modding when Hytale releases
mainText: 'It will be difficult in the beginning but you will be able to learn a thing every day. As the experienced modders and us are paving the way, you will be able to follow and learn. The fact we fix the game while it's live will allow the community to build a deep understanding & guides.'

summary: Slikey, re: user wanting to make an RTS style camera setup template
mainText: 'Hand me your requirements documents when you run into limitations. I want to incorporate it all into our roadmaps. I think point-and-click stuff with custom cameras will be interesting aswell to really allow RTS mods.'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking if Hytale can do peer-to-peer custom lobbies
mainText: 'Not yet but interesting concept. For now, you'd have to use the Singleplayer Friend Join via UPNP but yeah.. It will probably be server networks - maybe we can make minigames easier to discover than having to join servers. Maybe a discovery specifically for games like this that server networks can register into.. Hmm need to think more'

summary: Slikey, re: user surprised he is German
mainText: 'Schleswig-Holstein reporting in ü´°'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking if he did WC3
mainText: 'Yep, I have played a lot of Angel Arena, Element TD, LTW, TLTW and then continued in SC2 later. I myself made a bunch of LTW and Hero Line Wars. Never never really go anywhere but I used the chance to learn JASS and eventually go to Minecraft.'

summary: Simon, re: user asking if he modded in WC3
mainText: 'I did some warcraft 3, half life (Counter-Strike and Sven Co-op maps), neverwinter nights and some other games! Didn‚Äôt publish any of it though, just for my friends group'

summary: Slikey, re: comments comparing Hytale modding to Warcraft 3 Map Editor
mainText:
'My gamedev career started when I was around 10 years old and got my hands on the Warcraft 3 Map Editor. I made my own Line Tower Wars in it and it allowed me to understand how games are actually made. 
Seeing these comments compare our game to the thing that influenced me so much is giving me comfy boomer feelings... https://xcancel.com/Simon_Hypixel/status/2007888131350212658
'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking if players can connect using DNS or just IP
mainText: 'Yes, but we haven't added SRV records yet as there isn't a great library for C# and we dont have the proper time to implement it now.'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking if Hytale supports IPv6
mainText: 'Yeah.'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking if moving blocks is the only thing preventing a Create-style mod
mainText:
'It's a lot more that is missing. We have work to do but modding has always been about beating limitations and finding creative workarounds. 
Together with creative modders and our developers adding capabilities we got this.'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking what ISN'T possible in Hytale
mainText: 'I actually have a list of stuff that is critical for mods coming very soon. And it's only one of many lists. There are real limitations before we can look at mods like Create. I'll see if I can post something like that next week.'

summary: Slikey, re: the mod video
mainText:
'The code for this mod can't be released in its current form as we would need to go through the usual legal process of making sure none of the code is licensed. Additionally we want to show some best practise and given how quickly it was whipped up, I am sure other community members will be able to show much better results with much cleaner code.

We will see what we can do, but we don't want to split focus from game launch and not get distracted by side quests. I can't wait to see what other genres we see being brought to Hytale or an actual survivor game MMO server ü§©'

summary: Simon responds to the mod video
mainText: 'Our developers are having fun with Hytale in their spare time, I think it's a good sign of things to come :)'

summary: Simon, re: InTheLittleWood saying the mod video shows a lot of potential
mainText: 'The struggle is not to get too distracted and make mods ourselves all the timeüòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: KC saying the game is going to have so much content
mainText:
'We are a small team and there is a lot of work getting done, I can't keep up myself lol
Imagine with millions of players... oh boi'

summary: Simon shares video of server-side top-down wave shooter mod
mainText:
'The following video showcases a server-side Hytale mod created by a Hytale team member in their spare time. It‚Äôs intended purely as inspiration for how different genres could be realized within Hytale! 

The gameplay shown represents only a small subset of our modding capabilities and was used to build a simple, survivor-like experience. 
This mod is not planned for release as part of the game.'

(Gameplay Video, akin to Vampire Survivors)

summary: PXL_Panda, re: M4 Mac testing
mainText: 'I‚Äôm running Hytale on a M4 MacBook Pro :)'

summary: Simon, re: Hytale on Mac
mainText:
'I tested 2 days ago on a used $200 USD M1 Mac Mini with 8GB of RAM and was getting around 60 fps at 1080p with a bit over 200 view distance, not bad for now! Playing on a friend's server would make it much faster and stable as well. 

We still have a lot of performance fixes to do on the Mac version!'

summary: Oscar, re: MacOS support
mainText: 'Mac users rejoice! And now I don't have to switch between rigs to work anymore üòÑ'

summary: Slikey, re: MacOS support
mainText: 'Update: We got the certificate. We are all green. Details üëá'

summary: Slikey, re: MacOS Support
mainText: 'We'll reflect those Linux and Mac specifications on the website in the coming days.'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: MacOS support
mainText:
'We're happy to announce we will be shipping Hytale with macOS support on the 13th. 

Hytale will support any M-Series macs with the minimum requirements being: 
1080p @ 30 FPS @ 192 View Distance
- Apple M1 (any variant) w/macOS Tahoe
- 8 GB of RAM 
- At least 10 GB of free space on an SSD

Recommended requirements: 
1080p @ 60 FPS @ 384 View Distance
- Apple M2 (any variant) w/macOS Tahoe
- 16 GB of RAM
- At least 20 GB of free space on an SSD

See you in Orbis real soon!'

summary: Jannis (Blockbench) shares update to Hytale Blockbench Plugin
mainText:
'The Hytale Blockbench plugin now includes a Hytale preview scene and an optional player reference model. These should help visualize the size of your models in relation to the world of Hytale!
Both can be enabled from Preview Options.'

summary: Slikey, re: not supporting Intel Macs
mainText:
'It's simply that it's another build pipeline that we would have to set up, maintain and support. It would be technically possible but tech is rarely the problem. We are only capturing the major platforms. 
Also we couldn't find an M chip that wouldn't run it, so pretty much any M variant now.'

summary: Simon, re: user asking for cozy gameplay

summary: Simon, re: user asking if the blog is coming
mainText:
'Finished my review. Since the post is relatively technical and example-driven rather than showing off big worlds, we‚Äôre making a few changes to add clearer, more illustrative screenshots to avoid confusion. 

People are expecting some insane screenshots with a crazy, perfect world. This is more about the technical achievement and who can use it.'

summary: Simon, re: expectations for WGV2 blogpost
mainText:
'I feel like I have to temper expectations after seeing some comments! 

The World Gen V2 blog will focus mainly on the generation tech, tools and prototype examples to showcase what it can do and how. There isn‚Äôt much finished Orbis world content for it yet, so don't expect major screenshots/clips of the actual world! We only had time to make a few biomes, all of which are unfinished.

The good news is that it's designed to enable much faster content creation while giving us greater control. 

There will be a lot of screenshots, clips and text. If you only look at the visuals, you will not understand the scope of why this is a big step. 

To the untrained eye, it won't seem like a big deal. However, for those "who get it", it will be. 

I added my personal note at the end of the blogpost so that people can understand better.'

summary: Slikey, re: gifting by launch
mainText: 'We won't. We will try to add it asap post launch but for now we work off the items that are required for launch itself.'

summary: Simon, re: user reconfirming WGV2 will surpass  anything seen in the block game genre
mainText:
'Tech wise and usability, yes. 
You will see why.'

summary: SImon, re: World Gen V2 Blogpost
mainText:
'We‚Äôre finishing up the World Gen V2 blog post now. It should be ready today or tomorrow, and will go live by Monday at the latest.

With the release coming up in 10 days, things are a bit hectic, so blog ETAs may shift slightly. Thanks for your patience!'

summary: SImon, re: World Gen V2 Blogpost
mainText: 'We're working on it right now; we will be done today or tomorrow. Posting Monday at the latest, probably. Keep in mind that we are a bit overwhelmed by the upcoming release, so it's getting harder for me to make timing predictions.'
